---

After my favorite season of the year (football) is done, I also like to dabble in watching a little bit of basketball!

**Believe it or not** I actually used to play basketball in high school! I was the sixth man for our team and I purely came on to play <mark>defense</mark>. I didn't have a dangerous skillset on offense which probably cost me a *LOT* of playing time! 

Here's a [link](https://www.thecourierexpress.com/tri_county_sunday/sports/brockway-survives-to-beat-bradford-52-51/article_e58e6022-48d4-5a3a-a059-74feab8bfada.html) to probably the **best game** I ever played in High School even though I didn't score one point!

## Watching

Now that I am retired in playing basketball, I try to take some time every now and then to watch some games!

I think it is a nice pastime to help the cold, dreadful months go a bit quicker!


I would say my favorite kind of basketball to watch is college for a few reasons:

- College teams play defense

- MARCH MADNESS of course!

- The endless amount of games to watch in a season.


Unlike college football, it seems like the full college basketball season matters at all times.


Whether it be the [AP Top 25 rankings](https://www.espn.com/mens-college-basketball/rankings), the end-of-season conference tournaments, or sitting and waiting on Selection Sunday to hear your team's name called. Every college basketball team has something to look forward to in the months of November through March.

During March, you probably will see  a lot of these hanging throughout my room:

![bracket](data:image/png;base64,)

I am CONSTANTLY checking them to see if I will ever get a perfect bracket! I should probably play the lottery instead, it may be more fruitful.

Here's some tips on how to fill out an awesome  [bracket](https://www.covers.com/ncaab/march-madness/how-to-fill-out-bracket)!

I am so glad that college basketball has started again! With football and college basketball on, there's no way my TV is ever turning off all winter long.
